Name: METHYL ACETOACETATE
Description: Methylacetoacetic acid is an oxo carboxylic acid.

environmental_bioconcentrations.References: (1) Meylan WM, Howard PH; J Pharm Sci 84: 83-92 (1995) (2) Meylan WM et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 18: 664-72 (1999) (3) Franke C et al; Chemosphere 29: 1501-14 (1994)
environmental_bioconcentrations.Value: An estimated BCF of 3.1 was calculated for methyl acetatoactate(SRC), using an estimated log Kow of -0.69(1) and a regression-derived equation(2). According to a classification scheme(3), this BCF suggests the potential for bioconcentration in aquatic organisms is low(SRC).

environmental_biodegradations.References: (1) Chemicals Evaluation and Research Institute, Japan (CERIJ); Search at query page by CAS registry number, available at: https://qsar.cerij.or.jp/cgi-bin/QSAR/e_r_text_query.cgi as of September 27, 2004. (2) Zahn R, Wellens H; Z Wasser Abwasser Forsch 13: 1-7 (1980)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: AEROBIC: Methyl acetoacetate, present at 100 mg/L, reached 78% of its theoretical BOD in 2 weeks using an activated sludge inoculum at 30 mg/L and the Japanese MITI test(1). Methyl acetoacetate was degraded more than 90% in 2 days at 22 °C using activated sludge inoculum in a Zahn-Wellens screening test(2).

logP.References: US EPA; Estimation Programs Interface (EPI). ver. 3.11. U.S. EPA version for Windows. Washington, DC: U.S. EPA (2003). Available from, as of Sept 22, 2004: https://www.epa.gov/oppt/exposure/pubs/episuitedl.htm

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Bingham, E.; Cohrssen, B.; Powell, C.H.; Patty's Toxicology Volumes 1-9 5th ed. John Wiley & Sons. New York, N.Y. (2001)., p. V6 585
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ An 8-hr exposure to saturated vapor was not lethal to rats.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Bingham, E.; Cohrssen, B.; Powell, C.H.; Patty's Toxicology Volumes 1-9 5th ed. John Wiley & Sons. New York, N.Y. (2001)., p. V6 585
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ ...Slightly to moderately irritating to the eyes and skin /of rats/.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: EPA/Office of Pollution Prevention and Toxics; High Production Volume (HPV) Challenge Program's Robust Summaries and Test Plans. Methyl Acetoacetate. Available from, as of November 2, 2004: https://www.epa.gov/hpv/pubs/hpvrstp.htm
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Acute Exposure/ /Rats/ dosed /orally/ at 1.0 or 2.0 g/kg were observed to be sluggish and unkempt following intubation. Within 48 hr animals returned to normal behavior and appearance. Animals dosed at 2.5 to 4.0 g/kg exhibited lethargy, nasal hemorrhage and dirty, unkempt coats. At 8.0 g/kg all animals became comatose immediately following intubation and succumbed within 15 minutes of exposure. No postmortem or histopathology examinations were performed on any animals.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: EPA/Office of Pollution Prevention and Toxics; High Production Volume (HPV) Challenge Program's Robust Summaries and Test Plans. Methyl Acetoacetate. Available from, as of November 2, 2004: https://www.epa.gov/hpv/pubs/hpvrstp.htm
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Subchronic or Prechronic Exposure/ /Male and female/ Sprague-Dawley (Crl:CDB BR) /rats were dosed/ daily /by/ oral gavage /for a/ 4-wk exposure with 2-wk recovery for control and high dose subgroups. Dose levels: 0, 100, 300, and 1000 mg/kg/day; controls received vehicle (water). There were no premature deaths during the study. No clinical signs observed were considered to be as a result of treatment with the test substance. There were no notable intergroup body weight, food or water consumption differences in either sex. There were no effects noted in hematology, clinical chemistries or urinalyses considered to be toxicologically significant in either sex. There were no intergroup differences in either organ weights, necropsy or histological findings that were considered to be treatment related in either sex. On completion of 4 weeks of dosing all main study animals were sacrificed and necropsied and given a detailed post mortem examination with organs being weighed ( i.e. adrenals, brain, kidney, liver, ovaries and testis with epididymis) and tissues preserved in fixative (i.e. all abnormal tissue, adrenals, brain, ears, eyes, heart, kidney, liver, lung, marrow smear, optic nerve, ovaries, pituitary, spleen stomach, testis with epididymis, thyroid with parathyroid and urinary bladder). Histological examination was carried out on all control and high dose animals. After the 2 week recovery period all recovery study animals were sacrificed and processed in an identical manner.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: EPA/Office of Pollution Prevention and Toxics; High Production Volume (HPV) Challenge Program's Robust Summaries and Test Plans. Methyl Acetoacetate. Available from, as of November 2, 2004: https://www.epa.gov/hpv/pubs/hpvrstp.htm
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /LABORATORY ANIMALS: Developmental or Reproductive Toxicity/ /In a/ repeated dose and reproductive/developmental toxicity study in /male and female (12/sex) Crj:CD(SD)/ rats with administration by gavage /of/ 0 (vehicle), 100, 300, and 1000 mg/kg/day. Males were treated for 7 weeks; females were treated from 14-days prior to mating through day-3 of lactation. Toxic responses by dose: There were no premature deaths during the study. No clinical signs observed were considered to be as a result of treatment with the test substance. There were no notable intergroup body weight, food or water consumption differences in either sex. There were no effects noted in hemotology or clinical chemistries considered to be toxicologically significant in either sex. There were no intergroup differences in either organ weights, necropsy or histological findings that were considered to be treatment related in either sex. Paternal/maternal toxic responses by dose: There were no treatment related effects noted in estrous cycle, number of corpora lutea and implantations, copulation or fertility indices for males or females. Fetal toxic responses by dose: There were no treatment related effects noted on gestational days, litter and live born numbers, gestation index, stillborn index, birth index, sex ratio, body weights of offspring at birth and at day 4 post birth, or viability index on day 4. No external abnormalities were observed.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: EPA/Office of Pollution Prevention and Toxics; High Production Volume (HPV) Challenge Program's Robust Summaries and Test Plans. Methyl Acetoacetate. Available from, as of November 2, 2004: https://www.epa.gov/hpv/pubs/hpvrstp.htm
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /GENOTOXICITY/ Salmonella typhimurium TA 100, TA 1535, TA 98, TA 1537, and Escherichia coli WP2 uvrA /were tested for mutagenicity with and without metabolic activation at/ 0, 313 to 5000 ug/plate (5 strains). ...Material did not induce gene mutation in any of the Salmonella typhimurium or Escherichia coli WP2 uvrA strains tested.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: EPA/Office of Pollution Prevention and Toxics; High Production Volume (HPV) Challenge Program's Robust Summaries and Test Plans. Methyl Acetoacetate. Available from, as of November 2, 2004: https://www.epa.gov/hpv/pubs/hpvrstp.htm
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /GENOTOXICITY/ Chinese hamster lung (CHL/lU) cells /were tested with and without/ metabolic activation /using/ phenobarbital and 5,6-benzoflavone induced rat liver S9. Concentration tested: 0 (solvent), 0.30, 0.60 and 1.2 mg/mL. Test conditions: Solvent: Distilled water Positive controls: -S9 mix, Mitomycin C; and +S9 mix, Cyclophosphamide. Test exposures: -S9 mix (continuous treatment); -S9 mix (Short-term treatment); +S9 mix (Short-term treatment); +S9 mix (Short-term treatment with pH adjustment): 0, 1.2 mg/mL. Each test was conducted in duplicate. ...Material caused a significant increase in structural chromosomal aberrations (including gaps) and polyploidy following short-term treatment with metabolic activation, +S9 mix, at 1.2 mg/mL.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: EPA/Office of Pollution Prevention and Toxics; High Production Volume (HPV) Challenge Program's Robust Summaries and Test Plans. Methyl Acetoacetate. Available from, as of November 2, 2004: https://www.epa.gov/hpv/pubs/hpvrstp.htm
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: /GENOTOXICITY/ Bacterial reverse mutation test /was conducted using/ Salmonella typhimurium TA 1535, TA 1537, TA 1538, TA 98 and TA 100 /with and without metabolic activation, at/ 0 to 5000 ug/plate (5 strains). The study was conducted in triplicate after first determining the maximum concentration that does not significantly modify bacterial growth using the TA 98 and TA 100 test strains. ...Material was determined not to be mutagenic under the conditions of the assay.

soil_absorption_mobility.References: (1) Meylan WM et al; Environ Sci Technol 26: 1560-67 (1992) (2) Swann RL et al; Res Rev 85: 17-28 (1983)
soil_absorption_mobility.Value: Using a structure estimation method based on molecular connectivity indices(1), the Koc for methyl acetoacetate can be estimated to be 1.0(SRC). According to a classification scheme(2), this estimated Koc value suggests that methyl acetoacetate is expected to have very high mobility in soil.
